revised_title: Progressive Loss of Semantic Memory in Alzheimer's Disease: A Case Study
tldr: This study investigates the progressive breakdown of a patient's semantic memory due to Alzheimer's disease. The patient's ability to select between semantically related items in a word-picture matching task deteriorated until selection became random. Knowledge of category membership and specific features declined together over the same period. The findings support a theory of access to semantic memory that is non-hierarchical.
